entities.name: masked
entities.description: The event of masked has created confusion, uncertainty, and fear.

entities.name: Harry
entities.description: The person who is being referred to as the Boy Who Lived.

entities.name: Voldemort
entities.description: The person who is the main antagonist and enemy of Harry.

entities.name: Lupin
entities.description: A person who is a friend and ally to Harry.

entities.name: Dumbledore
entities.description: The old hero who has died, and whose death is being used by Voldemort to create doubt and fear.

entities.name: Ministry
entities.description: The governing body of the Wizarding world that is now moving against Muggleborns.

entities.name: Muggleborns
entities.description: A group of people who are born to non-magical parents but possess magical abilities.

entities.name: Daily Prophet
entities.description: The newspaper that is being pointed at by Lupin.

relationships.description: Harry and Voldemort are enemies, as stated in the text: 'the Boy Who Lived —were sure to be the symbol and rallying point for any resistance to Voldemort'.
Lupin is pointing at the Daily Prophet, as stated in the text: 'Lupin pointed at the Daily Prophet'.
The Ministry is moving against Muggleborns, as stated in the text: 'Meanwhile, the Ministry has started moving against Muggleborns'.

Voldemort is using Dumbledore's death to create doubt and fear, as stated in the text: 'But by suggesting that you had a hand in the old hero’s death, Voldemort has not only set a price upon your head, but sown doubt and fear amongst many who would have defended you'.
